Keywords: Deity , Hellfire Club , Monster , Mystical , Ruler
Real Name: Blackheart
Special Powers
PUTTING THE HELL IN HELLFIRE CLUB: Leadership. When Blackheart uses it and succeeds, you may instead generate a XMRF #006 Hellfire Club Guard on click #1. // POWER: Turn all friendly XMRF #006 Hellfire Club Guard to click #9.
HEART OF DARKNESS: If a character has been KO'd since your last turn, Blackheart deals penetrating damage. // FREE: Once per turn for all characters with this trait, KO a friendly XMRF #006 Hellfire Club Guard. If you did, remove all action tokens from Blackheart, heal him 1 click, and after resolutions he can use either Charge or Running Shot as FREE.
THE PRINCE OF HELL: STOP. Mastermind. Blackheart has [Cosmic Energy team ability]. When this click is first revealed, generate a XMRF #006 Hellfire Club Guard.

September 6, 2021
Hellboy the Bellboy
Speaking of beautiful, this sculpt looks like it stepped out of a Frank Frazetta painting. Absolutely gorgeous.
September 2, 2021
Redrover454
Whoo boy, what a beautiful fig. I love everything about this guy so here's just a few points. I've only played him at 75 btw. Mystics: With his stop he's dealing a minimum of 3 Mystics damage throughout the game, without healing at all. If you get your heals off, he can easily deal out up to 5 or 6 Mystics damage. That's 5 or 6 pen damage just baked into your force without rolling any dice. Transformation: What a game changing move. Bring a Club Guard with you on your charge, spit one out on your stop, spit one out on Leadership and then BAM 6 pen blades attacks right there in their face. One of those Guards could take out someone 3-4 times their point value. Absolutely brilliant, deadly, and unpredictable. KO Trait: So easily exploitable. You can move first turn, move/RS second turn, KO a Club Guard anywhere on the map, lose both tokens, heal if you need it, and then Penetrating RS or Charge Flurry Blades and then end your 2nd turn with 0 tokens after taking 2 costed actions. It doesn't get much better than that for a tentpole. Survivability: 2 stops, Mastermind, fodder generation, mystics, healing. Minimal reducers on his 75 but it's hardly a problem. Depending on how many Club Guards you have around and what kind of barrage is thrown at you, even on his 75 it could take 4, 5, or even 6 attacks to actually bring him down. I could say more but for the sake of brevity I'll leave it at that lol. The best part about him though? He's a blast to play!
August 28, 2021
wolfnet2000
@ DestructoBoy. read his second trait (Heart of Darkness). he can just KO a friendly Hellfire club guard to heal off that. then, if from the first STOP click, he gets toughness. though will that trigger the first half of the trait? if yes then suddenly he has Charge or Running shot with penetrating damage. and that stop click generates the Hellfire Club guard when it's first revealed

I literally cannot think of any good reason why he doesn't have damage reducers on his stop clicks. That's just ridiculous for a power called The Prince of Hell.
August 12, 2021
Goop
Very strong piece for his ability to turn your weak hellfire guards into that nasty click 9. 150 is a LOT of points though. Its really his stop clicks combined with healing and soldier generation that makes him super tough to bring down. If you dont get him past his stop clicks he will simply KO a guards and you have to deal with stop again.
